content: Can Insurgents really win against Partisans who are organized? It seems that Insurgents are a ragtag bunch who use violence to intimidate. If the Partisans organize and refuse to be intimidated they can defeat the Insurgents Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

Whether one fights in a "rebellion" or a "revolution" depends on if you are successful. Makes it all the more important to win. A history professor once told our class that the difference between a traitor and a patriot is the winner of the war. If the British has put down that little uprising by the colonials in the late 1700's, kids in New York would be attending Benedict Arnold HS. There would a Cornwallis University somewhere in Ohio. But that't not the case. The patriots won the Revolution and the name Benedict Arnold will always be synonymous with traitor.

content: quote: Originally posted by Vicdude: First please don't think I'm defending the insurgents in Iraq in any way, shape or form. If y'all find this topic offensive I hope the administrator will remove it. That being said, I've often made mental comparisons between the insurgents in Iraq and the partisans<SP> that fought in France and other countries, I guess, during WWII. Has anyone else had smiler thoughts? I'm with you sans one caveat - Iraqi insurgents are nothing akin to partisans, as a partisan defends his or her country. The Iraqi insurgents care nothing for patriotism; they just want to kill infidels because we're the debil. Unlike a partisan, they'll go anywhere to do just that. A partisan is only interested in the integrity of their homeland. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

title: Insurgents vs Partisans

content: quote: Iraqi insurgents are nothing akin to partisans, as a partisan defends his or her country. The Iraqi insurgents care nothing for patriotism; they just want to kill infidels because we're the debil. Unlike a partisan, they'll go anywhere to do just that. A partisan is only interested in the integrity of their homeland. Isn't the goal of the insurgents to drive the Great Satan from the world? Aren't they hell bent on making it an Islamic World? If that's the case, they don't have a single nation to be partisans of, but they are partisans of their world. The outcome will determine if they are partisans or insurgents. Afterall, if the Nazis had won WWII, wouldn't the partisans been tried as criminals/insurgents?
